text:
4/ Deaths due to COVID in Iquitos is ~2000. 

The Infection Fatality Rate (IFR) is ~0.7%. 

Case fatality rate (CFR) for confirmed symptomatic cases was ~14% 

CFR in Iquitos is similar to the mortality seen with symptomatic COVID in hotspots that got overwhelmed (NY, Lombardy)

2/ Population of Iquitos is 470,000. 
71% seroprevalence, the highest reported so far i~ 333000 cases

But confirmed cases are only 14711 (4.4%)

This means even assuming major undercounting, a lot of COVID, probably 80%, as expected is asymptomatic. @DrSidMukherjee

1/ Fascinating insights from Iquitos, Loreto Region, Peru. #COVID19 #COVID

1) They have achieved the 70% seroprevalence threshold for herd immunity.

Cases have dropped now in the region, as expected. 

@VincentRK @paimadhu

Is cross reactive immunity the reason why in the Antarctica cruise ship report, we had 10 rooms with 2 passengers each, in which one had COVID and one didn’t despite 20-30 days of close contact? https://t.co/L9jkiyFMQk

9/

These studies raise the question whether seroprevalence studies underestimate the proportion of the population that has some degree of immunity against COVID

We dont know if these T cell responses are protective and for how long. We still need to continue all the precautions 
7/

Germany: Cross-reactive SARS-CoV-2 T-cell epitopes revealed preexisting T-cell responses seem in 81% of unexposed individuals, and validation of similarity to common cold human coronaviruses.

Karolinska: Twice as many close family contacts of COVID patients had memory T cells against SARS CoV-2 compared to antibodies. https://t.co/1gNXjjyIhK

4/

Netherlands: 2 of 10 healthy controls with no prior exposure to COVID had evidence of reactive T cells.

La Jolla: 40-60% samples from persons with no prior exposure to COVID had T cell responses. @CellPressNews

2/

Cross reactive immunity to COVID?

Several studies now suggest that T cells reactive to COVID may be present even in persons without prior exposure to SARS CoV-2 suggesting presence of cross reactive immunity presumably from prior corona virus infections.
